alert.note: Alert for McPherson (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 04 at 12:07PM MDT until July 04 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central South Dakota, including the following counties, Edmunds and McPherson. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from storms last night to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 PM CDT, the McPherson County Sheriff and the Edmunds County Emergency Manager reported widespread flooding over southern McPherson County and northern Edmunds County from the heavy rain that fell last night. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain fell in this area, leading to water over numerous roads in the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ipswich, Leola, Roscoe, Hosmer, Wetonka, Hillsview, Plainview Colony, Deerfield Colony, Cravens Corner, Long Lake Colony, Grassland Colony and Mina Lake Rec Area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
